7.verification_summary: For a normal propensity distribution P with mean mu and variance sigma squared, P'(x)/P(x) equals minus (x minus mu) divided by sigma squared, hence f(x) equals gamma times that and the resulting force is linear with spring constant k equals gamma over sigma squared.

8.verification_summary: The mass relation matches the standard ground state variance formula for a harmonic oscillator; the gamma expression appears dimensionally inconsistent as written.
